user_message:
An agent A claimed that the following get_rq_dauth_algo code violates the MISRA C 2023 rule 8.13.
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<target_code>
Here is the original code of get_rq_dauth_algo.
```c
static enum MHD_DigestAuthAlgo3
get_rq_dauth_algo (const struct MHD_RqDAuthParam *const algo_param)
{
  if (NULL == algo_param->value.str)
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5; /* Assume MD5 by default */

  if (algo_param->quoted)
  {
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_MD5_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_SHA256_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_MD5_TOKEN _MHD_SESS_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_SHA512_256_TOKEN \
                                               _MHD_SESS_TOKEN))

      /* Algorithms below are not supported by MHD for authentication */

      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5_SESSION;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_SHA256_TOKEN \
                                               _MHD_SESS_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256_SESSION;
    if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_quoted_s_bin_n (algo_param->value.str, \
                                               algo_param->value.len, \
                                               _MHD_SHA512_256_TOKEN))
      return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256_SESSION;

    /* No known algorithm has been detected */
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_INVALID;
  }
  /* The algorithm value is not quoted */
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_MD5_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_SHA256_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_SHA512_256_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256;

  /* Algorithms below are not supported by MHD for authentication */

  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_MD5_TOKEN _MHD_SESS_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_MD5_SESSION;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_SHA256_TOKEN _MHD_SESS_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA256_SESSION;
  if (MHD_str_equal_caseless_s_bin_n_ (_MHD_SHA512_256_TOKEN _MHD_SESS_TOKEN, \
                                       algo_param->value.str, \
                                       algo_param->value.len))
    return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_SHA512_256_SESSION;

  /* No known algorithm has been detected */
  return MHD_DIGEST_AUTH_ALGO3_INVALID;
}
```
</target_code>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- explanation: your evaluation of the scenario provided by the agent A.
- is_report_correct: whether the report is correct or not (true/false). True means there is a violation.
</response format>
<scenario>
The agent A provided the following violation scenario:
If the member algo_param->value.str is declared as a non-const pointer (e.g. char *), then this use constitutes a violation: the value is only read (comparison functions) so the pointer should be const-qualified (const char *). In that case MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is violated — change value.str to const char * (and ensure any string-literal macros are treated as const) to comply.
</scenario>

<instruction>
Judge whether the report is correct or not.
</instruction>
explanation:
Agent A's report is essentially correct, but it is conditional. MISRA C:2023 Rule 8.13 requires that pointers should point to const-qualified types whenever possible. In this function the code only reads from algo_param->value.str (it never modifies the pointed-to characters), so if the struct member value.str is declared as a non-const pointer (e.g. char *), that is a breach of the intent of Rule 8.13 — the member should be declared as const char * so that the pointer type reflects read-only usage.

Notes and caveats:
- If value.str is already declared const char * (or the type is otherwise const-qualified), there is no violation. The given code does not show the struct definition, so whether a violation actually exists depends on that declaration.
- There are legitimate reasons why value.str might be non-const (the string is modified elsewhere, or the type must match an external API). In such cases making it const would be infeasible and Rule 8.13 would not force a change.
- If you change value.str to const char *, ensure other code that writes via that member is updated (or proves there are no writes). Also ensure any string-literal macros used are treated as const char[] to avoid incompatible pointer types.

Recommendation: If the member is currently char * and it is never used to modify the characters, change its type to const char * to comply with MISRA 8.13.
